meanings.definition: To divide into sections or categories.
meanings.sent1: She is compartmentalising her study materials for better organization.
meanings.sent2: I am compartmentalising my work tasks to focus on one at a time.
meanings.sent3: By compartmentalising her snacks, she avoided mixing up the flavors.
meanings.sent4: Compartmentalising our thoughts can help us manage stress effectively.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalising the toys into different bins made cleanup easier.

meanings.definition: To separate or isolate different aspects or parts.
meanings.sent1: He is compartmentalising his emotions to deal with them one by one.
meanings.sent2: The detective is compartmentalising the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: Compartmentalising his wardrobe by color made choosing outfits fun.
meanings.sent4: Compartmentalising our worries can help us address them individually.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalising the ingredients before cooking saves time in the kitchen.
